intro: Specularia speculum-veneris, commonly known as the Venus's looking-glass, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its scientific name reflects its historical association with the mythological figure Venus, due to the reflective appearance of its petals. The species is also noted for its medicinal properties, historically used in herbal remedies.
